==Japanese==

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=uc|rs=艸05|style=s|kyu=薴}}

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
|goon=[[じょ]] (jo)
|kanon=[[ちょ]] (cho)
|kanyoon=[[ま]] (ma)
|kun=[[お]] (o), [[からむし]] (karamushi), [[からんし]] (karanshi) {{qualifier|obsolete, rare}}, [[こるむし]] (korumushi) {{qualifier|obsolete, rare}}
}}

===Etymology 1===
{{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=お}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}}
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[o̞]}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|麻}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|お|hhira=を}}

# [[hemp]] or [[ramie]]
# [[thread]] made from the outer [[husk]] of the [[stem]]s of [[hemp]] or [[ramie]]
# a [[textile]] made from this thread

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-l|苧の実油|おのみあぶら|o no miabura}}: oil from the [[hemp]] or [[ramie]] seed
* {{ja-l|苧引き}}, {{ja-l|苧引き|おひき|ohiki}}: the [[process]] of [[pull]]ing the [[hemp]] or [[ramie]] [[fiber]]s from the [[husk]]
* {{ja-l|苧屋|おや|oya}}: a [[shop]] or [[store]] selling [[ramie]]
* {{ja-l|苧桶|おおけ|ooke}}: a [[tub]] or [[basin]] in which the collected [[hemp]] or [[ramie]] [[fiber]]s are placed
{{der-bottom}}

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|hemp}} {{ja-l|麻|あさ|asa}}
* {{sense|ramie}} {{ja-l|苧|からむし|karamushi}}
* {{sense|thread, in general}} {{ja-l|糸|いと|ito}}

===Etymology 2===
{{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=むし}}. Possibly the original name for the plant, or for the fiber from this plant.

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}}
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[mɯᵝɕi]}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|枲}} {{qualifier|rare}}, {{ja-l|帔}} {{qualifier|rare}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|むし}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=むし|obsolete}} old name for ''karamushi'': the [[ramie]] plant, {{taxlink|Boehmeria nivea var. nipononivea|variety|noshow=1}}
# short for {{ja-l|帔}}, {{ja-l|枲の垂衣|むしのたれぎぬ|mushi no tareginu}}, a kind of [[veil]] made of [[ramie]] and worn from the [[brim]] of a hat by women from the [[w:Heian period|Heian period]] through the [[w:Kamakura period|Kamakura period]]

===Etymology 3===
Appears to be a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|殻|tr1=kara|t1=husk|苧|tr2=mushi|t2=ramie fiber}}.

Some sources suggest that the ''mushi'' component derives from {{m|ja|蒸し|tr=mushi||steaming}}, from verb {{m|ja|蒸す|tr=musu||to steam something; to be steamy or muggy}}. However, ramie is not processed using steam, so these are more likely to be [[folk etymology|folk etymologies]].

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|n|か|ら|むし}}<ref name="NHK">{{R:NHK Hatsuon}}</ref>
* {{ja-accent-common|h|か|らむし}}<ref name="NHK"/>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ka̠ɺ̠a̠mɯᵝɕi]}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|苧麻}}, {{ja-l|紵}} {{qualifier|rare}}, {{ja-l|枲}} {{qualifier|rare}}, {{ja-l|葈}} {{qualifier|rare}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|からむし}}

# the [[ramie]] plant, {{taxlink|Boehmeria nivea|species|noshow=1}} or {{taxlink|Boehmeria nipononivea|species|noshow=1}}
# a [[thread]] made from the [[fiber]]s of this plant
# a [[textile]] made from this thread
#*: circa '''800''', ''Shibunritsu Ongi'' (page 47)<ref name="shibunritsu">
{{cite-book
|last=Tsukishima
|first=Hiroshi
|title=Kojisho Ongi Shūsei 2: Shibunritsu Ongi
|publisher=Kyūko Shoin
|year_published=1979
|page=47
|year=circa 800
|location=Tōkyō
|language=Japanese
|isbn=4-7629-3089-X
}}</ref>
#*: 蒭麻衣 '''加良牟斯'''衣

=====Derived terms=====
* {{ja-l|苧頭巾|からむしずきん|karamushi zukin}}: a {{m|ja|頭巾|tr=zukin||headcloth, bandana}} made from [[ramie]]

===Etymology 4===
Alteration from ''karamushi''. Rare and obsolete reading.

{{IPAchar|/karamuɕi/}} → {{IPAchar|/karanɕi/}}

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}}
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ka̠ɺ̠ã̠ɴɕi]}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|からんし}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=からんし|rare|obsolete}} the [[ramie]] plant
# {{lb|ja|sort=からんし|rare|obsolete}} a [[thread]] made from the [[fiber]]s of this plant
# {{lb|ja|sort=からんし|rare|obsolete}} a [[textile]] made from this thread

===Etymology 5===
Alteration from ''karamushi''. Rare and obsolete reading.

{{IPAchar|/karamuɕi/}} → {{IPAchar|/korumuɕi/}}

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}}
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[koɾ̠ɯᵝmɯᵝɕi]}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|こるむし}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=こるむし|rare|obsolete}} the [[ramie]] plant
# {{lb|ja|sort=こるむし|rare|obsolete}} a [[thread]] made from the [[fiber]]s of this plant
# {{lb|ja|sort=こるむし|rare|obsolete}} a [[textile]] made from this thread
#* circa '''800''', ''Shibunritsu Ongi'' (page 47)<ref name="shibunritsu"/>
#*: 纎麻衣 '''古流牟斯'''衣

===Etymology 6===
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=ま}} {{m|ltc|薴}}, but read with the [[音読み#Japanese|''on'yomi'']] from {{m|ja|麻|tr=ma||hemp}}. Compare modern {{cog|cmn|苧|tr=zhù}}, {{m|cmn|麻|tr=má}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|慣用読み|Kan'yōyomi}}
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ma̠]}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|麻}}

====Affix====
{{ja-pos|affix|ま}}

# the [[ramie]] or [[hemp]] plant or fiber

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-l|苧物|まもの|mamono}}: a [[rope]] or [[line]] made of [[hemp]] or [[ramie]] [[fiber]]
* {{ja-l|苧麻|まお|mao}}: [[ramie]]; a kind of [[thread]] made from [[ramie]]; {{qualifier|slang}} [[adultery]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 7===
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=ちょ}} {{m|ltc|薴}}. Compare modern {{cog|cmn|苧|tr=zhù}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[t͡ɕʲo̞]}}

====Affix====
{{ja-pos|affix|ちょ}}

# the [[ramie]] or [[hemp]] plant or fiber

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-l|苧麻|ちょま|choma}}: [[hemp]] or [[ramie]]
{{der-bottom}}
